remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated closed provided:

numlitem.para: Equipment cooling is operated with one fan cooling,
Remaining fan is operative, and
For operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C) at least one pack is operative.

note.para: Forward cargo heating will not be available with one fan deactivated.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Ensure at least one pack is operative for operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C).
If Supply Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG SUP FAN may remain annunciated.
If Exhaust Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG EXH FAN may remain annunciated.
Carriage of animals and perishables in associated lower forward cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Install Placards adjacent to the Equipment Cooling selector " GND EXH VLV INOP CLOSED" and "EXH FAN INOP or SUPPLY FAN INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To deactivate Ground Exhaust Valve closed with Supply Fan or Exhaust Fan deactivated:
Position the Temperature Control panel (P5) EQUIP COOLING selector to STBY.
Open the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV GND circuit breaker.

note.para: The shorting wire and plug in the following steps is UPS P/N 747-21-002-101, if available.

numlitem.para: Fabricate a 3 to 4 inch shorting wire from type 6A (BMS 13-60 Type 1 or BMS 13-48 Type 10) wire and two P/N BACC47CN-1 (or P/N BACC47CN1S) pin contacts.
Obtain shorting plug P/N BACC45FN12-12P and, using fabricated shorting wire, short pin numbers 1 & 2 on the shorting plug.
Disconnect electrical connector from Ground Exhaust Valve located in the forward cargo floor area at STA 550.
Install shorting plug, P/N BACC45FN12-12P with shorting wire attached, on the electrical connector and stow.

note.para: The shorting wire is installed so EQUIP COOLING cautionary message and EE CLNG GND EXH status message will not display due to the disabled Ground Exhaust Valve.

numlitem.para: Close the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV GND circuit breaker.
Open and collar the P414 panel EQPT COOLING SUPPLY FAN or the P415 panel EQPT COOLING EXHAUST FAN circuit breaker as appropriate.

note.para: Cooling system re-configures to closed-loop mode within 30 seconds.

numlitem.para: Determine Ground Exhaust Valve position. If not already closed, manually position the valve in the closed position:
Insert 3/8 inch drive wrench into the ground exhaust valve manual drive collar located on aircraft skin adjacent to valve flapper door.
Push manual drive collar in approximately 3/8 inch and rotate counter-clockwise to close valve.
Ensure valve closed by visual check of flapper position.

note.para: If Supply Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG SUP FAN may remain annunciated.
If Exhaust Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG EXH FAN may remain annunciated
Temperature gradients are to be expected during these inoperative conditions. Predicted cargo compartment temperatures (which may vary) when forward cargo heat is inoperative:

entry.para: Ground operation – steady state temperatures with A/C Packs ON
